byline.docAuthor: R. A . Nelson and L. Ruby

front.div:
Abstract. A modified system of SI units is described that includes a new category of "physiological units". In
this system, physiological units are a special class of derived units that are defined with respect to specified
reference stimuli for the purpose of calibrating the nominal human response to external physical effects. This
new category includes the unit of luminous intensity, the candela, and the unit of dose equivalent, the sievert.
By comparison with the current SI, in the modified SI the candela is classified as a physiological derived unit
instead of as a base unit and the definition of the sievert is revised to include specification of the reference
radiation.
